name: Browser History Sorting
description:
You are a developer at a new and promising browser company, and are tasked with designing their browser history sorting system. Your goal is to take a tuple of tuples containing the date/time, and title of each individual page, along with a method on how to sort the tuple, and return it as a sorted list or dictionary (See Specifications).
 

Specifications:
- Date will be a collection of positive integers (and zero) in the form of XX/XX/XXXX, Time will be XX:XX (also positive integers + zero) 
- If sorted by date/time, return a dictionary containing keys that are "Today", "Yesterday", "This Week", "This Month", "This Year", and "Past a Year" (if there are entries within these time periods) and corresponding values that contain a list of entries within these time periods (sorted by date and time)
- If sorted by title, it should return it sorted by a priority of capital letters, then prioritized by regular alphabetization.
- For simplicity's sake, treat a "month" as 30 days and a "year" as 365
- Time will be in 24 hour format "00:00" with leading zeros for both the hour and minute
- Current (year) will be in format "10/09/2010" and between "01/01/2000" and "12/31/2024"
- Dates in history will be in the same format as above and between "01/01/2000" and "current" (inclusive)
- Title (URL) will be in the format "www.randomText.com" with randomText only consiting of ASCII letters.
- If multiple tuples are put in a single list, the greater date will come first. (See Example Outputs)

Example Outputs:
  - For Date:
  
``` 
{
    "Today": [("09/07/2022", "12:15", "www.example1.com"), ("09/07/2022", "08:30", "www.example2.com")],
    "This Month": [("08/30/2022", "09:45", "www.example3.com")],
    "Past a Year": [("07/15/2021", "14:30", "www.example4.com"), ("05/09/2019", "10:00", "www.example5.com")]
} 
```
  - For Title:
  
```
[
    ("08/30/2022", "09:45", "www.ABC.com"),
    ("07/15/2021", "14:30", "www.ZZTop.com"),
    ("09/07/2022", "08:30", "www.example1.com"),
    ("09/07/2022", "12:15", "www.example2.com")
]
```
